title: Masterclass on Mathematical Regularization Techniques for Neural Network Structure Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of in-depth studies and advanced project experience, foundational linear algebra and probability theory, and understanding of gradient descent and loss function optimization
context.additional_context: A course for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to acquire efficient neural network design methods without complex modeling, emphasizing practical problem-solving skills through mathematical modeling and computational graph analysis.

learning_goals: Achieve over 90% training efficiency (computational optimization) by applying Jumpstart normalization techniques to a simple ReLU network structure.
Perform quantitative analysis (formula-based evaluation) of model performance using Dead Units and Linear Units metrics.

Learners can compare three normalization techniques (L1/L2 penalty, dropout probability, batch normalization mean-variance adjustment), implement an optimization strategy to reduce overfitting indicators (training accuracy - validation accuracy gap) to below 10% on a given image classification project, and submit a report with mathematical proof.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
